Prerequisites: COMPLETION OF ALL LOWER DIVISION COURSEWORK; ACG 4111
Course Description: DISCUSSES THE DETERMINATION AND CONTROL OF PRODUCTION COSTS, JOB ORDER AND PROCESS SYSTEMS, ACTUAL AND STANDARD COSTS, BUDGETARY CONTROL, PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT, ETHICS AND SHORT-RUN DECISION MODELS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, STUDENTS ARE ABLE TO:
1.  UNDERSTAND THE ROLE OF COST MANAGEMENT AND COST BEHAVIOR
2.  IDENTIFY VARIOUS PLANNING AND BUDGETING TECHNIQUES
3.  UNDERSTAND VARIOUS PERFORMANCE MEASURES INCLUDING BALANCED SCORECARDS AND QUALITY CONTROL PRINCIPLES
4.  IDENTIFY COST MEASUREMENT CONCEPTS SUCH AS STANDARD, JOINT AND BY-PRODUCT COSTING
5.  UNDERSTAND JOB ORDER, PROCESS, ACITIVITY-BASED COSTING AND PRODUCTION COSTS
6.  IMPROVE RESEARCH, ORAL AND WRITTEN COMMUNICATION SKILLS
7.  DISCUSS PRINCIPLES OF ETHICAL AND PROFESSIONAL BUSINESS CONDUCT
Textbook(s): COST MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTING & CONTROL, 5TH EDITION  THOMSON SOUTH-WESTERN
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
